meanings.definition: Remove an amino group from (a molecule).
meanings.sent1: She was deaminating the compound in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The enzyme is deaminating the protein to alter its structure.
meanings.sent3: The scientist accidentally spilled the deaminating solution on her shoes.
meanings.sent4: His sharp wit was like deaminating words, stripping away unnecessary layers.
meanings.sent5: The process of deaminating can change the properties of the substance significantly.

meanings.sent1: The protein will deaminating during the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent2: Cells deaminating as part of their natural metabolic processes.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be deaminating after eating the fish.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like it was deaminating under the pressure of the exam.
meanings.sent5: The leaves were deaminating, turning yellow as autumn approached.
